name: batch_delete_messages
description: Permanently deletes many messages by ID and cleans up any unreferenced attachments.

userId.description: The user's email address; 'me' indicates the authenticated user and is the default.

ids.description: A list of message IDs to delete, defaulting to None.

name: batch_modify_message_labels
description: Modifies labels on multiple messages simultaneously by adding or removing them based on a provided list of IDs.

userId.description: The user's email address, defaulting to 'me' for the authenticated user.

ids.description: A list of message IDs for modification, defaulting to `None` or an empty list.

addLabelIds.description: A list of label IDs to add, processed case-insensitively and stored in uppercase. Defaults to None.

removeLabelIds.description: A list of label IDs to remove, handled case-insensitively. Defaults to None.

name: check_user_exists
description: Check if a user exists.

userId.description: The user ID to check.

name: create_draft
description: Create a new draft message using the provided content, or an empty draft if no content is specified, with a 25MB limit for individual attachments and a 100MB limit for the total message size.

userId.description: The user's email address, or `'me'` to indicate the authenticated user (default: `'me'`).

id.description: A unique identifier for the draft, which is auto-generated if not provided.

threadId.description: The ID of the thread the message belongs to.

raw.description: An optional, base64url-encoded (RFC 4648 Section 5) string of the entire RFC 2822 compliant message. Supports multipart MIME attachments, with a limit of 25MB per attachment and 100MB total message size. If omitted, the message is constructed from other fields.

labelIds.description: An array of label IDs applied to the message.

snippet.description: A short excerpt from the message text.

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.

internalDate.description: The internal message creation timestamp in epoch milliseconds.

sizeEstimate.description: The estimated size of the message in bytes.

body.description: The text of the message body.

isRead.description: Indicates whether the message has been read.

date.description: The creation date of the message.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the message.
The MIME type of the part.

size.description: The size of the attachment in bytes (max 25MB per attachment).

parts.description: A list of message parts representing attachments.

payload.description: A key-value object representing the parsed email structure.

message.description: The message to be saved as a draft.

draft.description: A dictionary of key-value pairs for the draft message. This parameter is optional.

name: create_label
description: Create a new label for the user, applying properties from the `label` argument or using default values.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' for the authenticated user (defaults to 'me').

name.description: The label's display name, in uppercase.

messageListVisibility.description: Controls the visibility of messages with this label in the message list; valid values are `'show'` or `'hide'`, defaulting to `'show'`.

labelListVisibility.description: Sets the label's visibility in the label list, accepting 'labelShow', 'labelShowIfUnread', or 'labelHide'; defaults to 'labelShow'.

type.description: The label's owner type, defaulting to 'user' and required to be 'user' for custom labels; 'system' is also an internally valid type.

textColor.description: The label's text color, represented as a hex string.

backgroundColor.description: Background color as a #RRGGBB hex string.

color.description: A dictionary specifying the label's color with `textColor` (hex string) and `backgroundColor` (hex string, e.g., `#RRGGBB`) keys.

label.description: An optional dictionary specifying new label properties, including `name` (str), `messageListVisibility` (str: 'show'|'hide'), `labelListVisibility` (str: 'labelShow'|'labelShowIfUnread'|'labelHide'), `type` (str: 'user'), and `color` (Dict[str, str] for hex `textColor` and `backgroundColor`).

name: create_send_as_alias
description: Creates a new 'Send as' alias by adding a custom 'from' email address to the user's account, identified by the alias email address.

userId.description: The user's email address, defaulting to 'me' to indicate the authenticated user.

sendAsEmail.description: The email address for the alias.

signature.description: The email signature for the alias.

send_as.description: An optional dictionary for new alias properties, including `sendAsEmail` (str), `displayName` (str), `replyToAddress` (str), and `signature` (str).

name: create_user
description: Creates a new user entry and initializes its data structure with profile, empty drafts, messages, threads, labels, settings, history, and watch configuration.

userId.description: The unique identifier for the new user.

profile.description: A dictionary for initial profile information requiring an `emailAddress` (str) key; other keys are permitted but ignored. Example: `{"emailAddress": "user@example.com", "displayName": "John Doe"}`.

name: delete_draft
description: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified draft message from the user's mailbox, also cleaning up unreferenced attachments.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' for the authenticated user (defaults to 'me').

id.description: The ID of the draft to delete; defaults to an empty string.

name: delete_label
description: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified label from the user's list; this operation cannot be undone.

userId.description: The user's email address; use the special value 'me' for the authenticated user (defaults to 'me').

id.description: The ID of the label to delete, defaulting to an empty string.

name: delete_message
description: Permanently deletes a specified message from a user's mailbox, an irreversible operation that also cleans up unreferenced attachments.

userId.description: The user's email address; defaults to 'me' to indicate the authenticated user.

id.description: The ID of the message to delete, defaulting to an empty string.

name: delete_send_as_alias
description: Deletes a custom 'from' address (alias), identified by its email address, from the user's account.

userId.description: The user's email address, where 'me' indicates the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the 'Send as' alias to delete, defaulting to an empty string.

name: delete_send_as_smime_info
description: Deletes the S/MIME info identified by its ID from the specified 'Send as' alias configuration.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the 'Send as' alias from which to delete S/MIME information; defaults to `''`.

id.description: The ID of the S/MIME info to delete; defaults to an empty string.

name: delete_thread
description: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified thread and all associated messages from the user's mailbox.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' to indicate the authenticated user, which is also the default value.

id.description: The ID of the thread to delete, defaulting to ''.

name: get_auto_forwarding_settings
description: Get the auto-forwarding settings for the specified user.

userId.description: The user's email address, where 'me' indicates the authenticated user; defaults to 'me'.

name: get_draft
description: Retrieves a specified draft message by ID, with the returned data determined by the `format` parameter: `minimal` (email ID and labels), `full` (full message with parsed body), `raw` (full message with raw body), or `metadata` (email ID, labels, and headers).

userId.description: The user's email address, defaulting to 'me' to indicate the authenticated user.

id.description: The ID of the draft to retrieve; defaults to an empty string.

format.description: The message return format, one of `'minimal'`, `'full'`, `'raw'`, or `'metadata'`. Defaults to `'full'`.

name: get_imap_settings
description: Gets the IMAP settings for the specified user.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' to represent the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

name: get_label
description: Gets the label resource identified by its ID.

userId.description: The user's email address; use `'me'` for the authenticated user (defaults to `'me'`).

id.description: The ID of the label to retrieve; defaults to ''.

name: get_language_settings
description: Retrieves the language configuration, such as the display language, for the specified user.

userId.description: The user's email address; use the special value 'me' to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

name: get_message
description: Retrieves a message by its ID, with a customizable response format.

userId.description: The user's email address; 'me' is a special value indicating the authenticated user and is also the default.

id.description: The ID of the message to retrieve; defaults to `''`.

format.description: The format for the returned message: 'minimal' (ID and labels), 'full' (full data with body), 'raw' (full RFC 2822 compliant data, potentially including attachments), or 'metadata' (ID, labels, and headers). Defaults to 'full'.

metadata_headers.description: A list of strings specifying headers to include when `format='metadata'`; defaults to `None`.

name: get_message_attachment
description: Retrieves the content of a specific attachment by its ID, verifying it is referenced in the specified message.

user_id.description: The user's email address, defaulting to `me` to represent the authenticated user.

message_id.description: The ID of the message containing the attachment; must be a non-empty string and defaults to `''`.

id.description: The ID of the attachment to retrieve; it must be a non-empty string and defaults to ''.

name: get_pop_settings
description: Retrieves the Post Office Protocol (POP) configuration for the specified user's account.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' for the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

name: get_send_as_alias
description: Retrieves the specified 'Send as' alias configuration, identified by its email address.

userId.description: The user's email address, defaulting to 'me' to indicate the authenticated user.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the 'Send as' alias to retrieve; defaults to `''`.

name: get_send_as_smime_info
description: Get a specific S/MIME certificate configuration by ID for a user's 'Send as' alias.

userId.description: The user's email address; 'me' is a special value that indicates the authenticated user and is also the default.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the 'Send as' alias, defaulting to `''`.

smime_id.description: The ID of the S/MIME info to retrieve; defaults to ''.

name: get_thread
description: Retrieve the details of a specific thread by its ID.

userId.description: The user's email address; 'me' indicates the authenticated user and is the default.

id.description: The ID of the thread to retrieve; defaults to `''`.

format.description: Specifies the format for returned messages: 'full' (full message data), 'metadata' (message ID, labels, and headers), 'minimal' (message ID and labels), or 'raw' (full message data); defaults to 'full'.

metadata_headers.description: A list of headers to include when `format` is 'metadata'; defaults to `None`, which includes Subject, From, To, and Date headers with case-insensitive matching.

name: get_user_profile
description: Gets the user's Gmail profile information for the specified user ID.

userId.description: The user's email address; 'me' specifies the authenticated user and is the default value.

name: get_vacation_settings
description: Gets the vacation responder settings for the specified user.

userId.description: The user's email address; defaults to 'me' for the authenticated user.

name: import_message
description: Imports a message into the mailbox, applying specified labels using `msg`'s `raw` content and adding the 'DELETED' label if `deleted` is true, while ignoring `internal_date_source`, `never_mark_spam`, and `process_for_calendar` for API compatibility.

userId.description: The user's email address; 'me' indicates the authenticated user and is the default.

msg.description: An optional dictionary with message data, including `raw` (str) for the raw message content and other optional properties.

internal_date_source.description: Specifies how to determine the internal date; defaults to 'dateHeader' (currently ignored).

never_mark_spam.description: A boolean to prevent the message from being marked as spam; defaults to `False` and is currently ignored.

process_for_calendar.description: Indicates whether to process calendar invitations; defaults to `False` and is currently ignored.

deleted.description: Marks the imported message as deleted, defaulting to `False`.

name: insert_message
description: Inserts a user-composed message (e.g., a draft) into the mailbox, generating a new message and thread ID with 'INBOX' and 'UNREAD' labels applied by default; individual attachments cannot exceed 25MB, and the total message size cannot exceed 100MB.

userId.description: The user's email address, or the special value `me` to indicate the authenticated user (defaults to `me`).

threadId.description: The ID of the thread that contains the message.

raw.description: The raw content of the message.

sender.description: The email address of the sender.

internalDate.description: The internal date of the message.

isRead.description: Indicates if the message has been read.

labelIds.description: A list of uppercase labels to apply to the message.

msg.description: An optional dictionary containing the message data.

internal_date_source.description: Specifies how the message's `internalDate` is set when not provided in the payload. Options are: `receivedTime` (default), which sets the date to the processing time, or `dateHeader`, which derives the date from the `msg['date']` field, falling back to the processing time if the header is missing or invalid.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the inserted message should be marked as deleted, defaulting to `False`.

name: insert_send_as_smime_info
description: Inserts a new S/MIME certificate configuration for the specified 'Send as' alias, generating a unique ID.

userId.description: The user's email address, or 'me' for the authenticated user; defaults to 'me'.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the 'Send as' alias for S/MIME info association, defaulting to an empty string.

encryptedKey.description: The encrypted key for the S/MIME certificate.

smime.description: An optional dictionary of S/MIME properties, including `encryptedKey` (str) and other optional properties.

name: list_drafts
description: List draft messages for a user, optionally filtering by a query string that supports `from:`, `to:`, `subject:`, `body:`, `label:`, and general keywords.

userId.description: The user's email address, defaulting to 'me' to indicate the authenticated user.

max_results.description: Maximum number of drafts to return; must be a positive integer, defaults to 100.

q.description: A query string to filter drafts, supporting `term:value` formats for `from:`, `to:`, `subject:`, `body:`, `label:`, and general keywords; defaults to `''`.

name: list_history_records
description: Lists mailbox history records up to `max_results`; filtering and pagination parameters are currently ignored.

userId.description: The user's email address, defaulting to 'me' to indicate the authenticated user.

max_results.description: The maximum number of history records to return; defaults to 100.

page_token.description: A page token to retrieve a specific page of results; defaults to `''` and is currently ignored.

start_history_id.description: Returns history records after the specified `start_history_id`; defaults to `''` and is currently ignored.

label_id.description: Specifies the label (in uppercase) for which to retrieve history records; defaults to '', but is currently ignored.

history_types.description: A list of history types to retrieve; defaults to `None` and is currently ignored.

name: list_labels
description: Lists all labels in the user's mailbox.

userId.description: The user's email address; defaults to `me` for the authenticated user.

name: list_messages
description: List messages in the user's mailbox, filtering by query string (`q` for keywords, `from:`, `to:`, `label:`, `subject:`), specific `labelIds`, and optional inclusion of `TRASH` or `SPAM` messages.

userId.description: The user ID; use `'me'` to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to `'me'`.

max_results.description: The maximum number of messages to return; must be a positive integer and defaults to 100.

q.description: A query string for filtering messages, where space-delimited tokens are combined by implicit AND, supporting `from:<email>`, `to:<email>`, `label:<LABEL_ID>` (uppercase ID), `subject:<text>`, `<keyword>`, and `"<phrase>"`, with strings containing spaces or exact phrases requiring enclosure in single or double quotes.

labelIds.description: A list of label IDs that messages must have; defaults to `None`.

include_spam_trash.description: Includes messages from SPAM and TRASH; defaults to `False`.

name: list_send_as_aliases
description: List a user's custom 'from' addresses, also known as 'Send as' aliases.

userId.description: The user's email address, or 'me' to represent the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

name: list_send_as_smime_info
description: Lists all S/MIME certificate configurations for a specific 'Send as' alias, identified by user ID and alias email address.

userId.description: The user's email address; 'me' indicates the authenticated user and is the default.

send_as_email.description: The email address for the 'Send as' alias, defaulting to an empty string.

name: list_threads
description: Lists threads in the user's mailbox, though filtering by query parameters (`q`, `labelIds`, `include_spam_trash`, `page_token`) is not performed.

userId.description: The user's email address, or 'me' to indicate the authenticated user (defaults to 'me').

max_results.description: Maximum number of threads to return, defaulting to 100, with a maximum allowed value of 500; actual results may be fewer.

page_token.description: A page token for retrieving a specific page of results, defaulting to '', and currently ignored.

q.description: A query string to match threads, supporting the Gmail search box format; defaults to ''. Note: Currently ignored.

labelIds.description: A list of uppercase label IDs to match all threads against; defaults to `None`. Note: This parameter is currently ignored.

include_spam_trash.description: Includes threads from SPAM and TRASH in the results; defaults to `False` but is currently ignored.

name: modify_message_labels
description: Adds or removes labels from a message, handling them case-insensitively, converting to uppercase, removing duplicates, and storing in a sorted list; enforces exclusivity where INBOX is removed when SENT, DRAFT, or TRASH are added, and can only be added if none of those are present; custom labels are supported.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' for the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the message to modify; defaults to an empty string.

addLabelIds.description: A list of label names to add; these are case-insensitive and stored in uppercase. Defaults to None.

removeLabelIds.description: A list of label names to remove; names are processed case-insensitively and stored in uppercase. Defaults to `None`.

name: modify_thread_labels
description: Modifies labels on a specified thread by adding or removing them from all messages within it.

userId.description: The user's email address, where 'me' indicates the authenticated user.

id.description: The string ID of the thread to modify.

addLabelIds.description: A list of label IDs to add to this message, with a limit of 100 labels per update.

removeLabelIds.description: A list of IDs of labels to remove from messages within the thread, supporting up to 100 labels per update.

name: patch_label
description: Updates an existing label by its ID, fully replacing its properties with those from the `label` argument; this function is an alias for `update`.

userId.description: The user's email address, where 'me' indicates the authenticated user and is the default value.

id.description: The ID of the label to update; defaults to an empty string.

name.description: The display name of the label.

messageListVisibility.description: The visibility of messages with this label in the message list; must be 'show' or 'hide'.

labelListVisibility.description: Specifies the label's visibility in the label list, one of `'labelShow'`, `'labelShowIfUnread'`, or `'labelHide'`.

type.description: The owner type for the label, either `user` or `system`.

messagesTotal.description: The total number of messages with the label.

messagesUnread.description: The number of unread messages with the label.

threadsTotal.description: The total number of threads with the label.

threadsUnread.description: Number of unread threads associated with the label.

textColor.description: The label's text color, represented as a hex string.

backgroundColor.description: The background color as a hex string in `#RRGGBB` format.

color.description: The color assigned to the label, as a dictionary with `textColor` (hex string) and `backgroundColor` (hex string #RRGGBB) keys.

label.description: An optional dictionary of properties to update the label, such as `name`, `messageListVisibility`, `labelListVisibility`, `type`, and `color`, defaulting to an empty dictionary if None.

name: patch_send_as_alias
description: Updates the specified 'Send as' alias configuration; this `update` alias performs a full update.

userId.description: The user's email address; 'me' indicates the authenticated user and is the default.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the alias to update; defaults to an empty string.

displayName.description: The display name for the alias.

send_as.description: An optional dictionary containing alias properties to update, with keys such as `displayName`, `replyToAddress`, and `signature`.

name: patch_send_as_smime_info
description: Updates the specified S/MIME certificate configuration as a full replacement.

userId.description: The user's email address; 'me' indicates the authenticated user and is the default.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the 'Send as' alias, defaulting to an empty string.

id.description: The ID of the S/MIME information to update or patch; defaults to `''`.

encryptedKey.description: The encrypted key for the S/MIME certificate.

smime.description: An optional dictionary containing S/MIME properties to update, such as `encryptedKey` (str) for the S/MIME certificate.

name: send_draft
description: Sends a draft message, which is deleted if sent using an existing `id`; otherwise, sends the raw message content directly if no valid `id` is provided, enforcing a 25MB limit per attachment and a 100MB total message size limit.

userId.description: The user's email address or the special value `me` to indicate the authenticated user; defaults to `me`.

id.description: ID of the existing draft to send.

threadId.description: ID of the thread this message belongs to.

raw.description: An optional, base64url-encoded (RFC 4648 Section 5), RFC 2822 compliant message string, including any multipart MIME attachments (max 25MB each, 100MB total); if not provided, the message is constructed from other fields.

internalDate.description: The internal message creation timestamp, in epoch milliseconds.

labelIds.description: A list of label IDs to apply to the message.

snippet.description: A snippet of the message text.

historyId.description: ID of the last history record modifying this message.

body.description: The body text of the message.

isRead.description: Indicates if the message has been read.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the message payload.
The MIME type of the part.

size.description: The size of the attachment in bytes (max 25MB per attachment).

parts.description: A list of message parts that are the attachments.

payload.description: The parsed structure of the email message:

message.description: An object containing the message content to send.

draft.description: An optional dictionary of key-value pairs representing the draft to send.

name: send_message
description: Sends a `base64url-encoded` RFC 2822 MIME message, automatically processing attachments while enforcing a 25MB limit per attachment and a 100MB total message size.

userId.description: The user's email address or the special value `'me'` to indicate the authenticated user, defaulting to `'me'`.

raw.description: An optional, entire RFC 2822 compliant message as a base64url-encoded string (RFC 4648 Section 5), which can include attachments up to 25MB each (100MB total); if omitted, the message is constructed from other fields like `sender` and `recipient`.

threadId.description: The ID of the thread to assign to the message; if not specified, a new thread is created with an auto-generated ID.

labelIds.description: A list of label IDs to apply to the message, in addition to the automatically applied `SENT` label.

recipient.description: The email address of the recipient.

body.description: The plain text body of the message.

date.description: The date of the message, formatted as RFC 2822.

internalDate.description: An internal timestamp in milliseconds since the Unix epoch.

isRead.description: Indicates if the message has been read.

msg.description: An optional dictionary containing message data.

name: set_default_send_as_smime_info
description: Sets the S/MIME info identified by `id` as the default for the 'Send as' alias, removing default status from other configurations for that alias.

userId.description: The user's email address, or 'me' to indicate the authenticated user; defaults to 'me'.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the 'Send as' alias, defaulting to `''`.

id.description: The ID of the S/MIME information to set as default; defaults to an empty string.

name: stop_mailbox_watch
description: Stop push notifications for a user's mailbox by clearing their watch configuration.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' for the authenticated user, which is also the default.

name: trash_message
description: Moves the specified message to the trash by adding the 'TRASH' label, remaining unchanged if already labeled.

userId.description: The user's email address; use `'me'` for the authenticated user (defaults to `'me'`).

id.description: The ID of the message to trash; defaults to `''`.

name: trash_thread
description: Moves the specified thread to the trash, marking it and all its messages as trashed.

userId.description: The user's email address, defaulting to 'me' which indicates the authenticated user.

id.description: The ID of the thread to trash. Defaults to ''.

name: untrash_message
description: Removes the specified message from the trash by removing its 'TRASH' label; if the message lacks this label, it remains unchanged.

userId.description: The user's email address, or 'me' for the authenticated user (defaults to 'me').

id.description: The ID of the message to untrash; defaults to an empty string.

name: untrash_thread
description: Restores the specified thread and all its messages from the trash.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' to indicate the authenticated user (defaults to 'me').

id.description: The ID of the thread to untrash, defaulting to ''.

name: update_auto_forwarding_settings
description: Updates the specified user's auto-forwarding configuration, applying only the fields present in the provided settings.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' for the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

emailAddress.description: A valid email address to forward messages to.

disposition.description: Specifies how to handle forwarded messages, with valid values: `dispositionUnspecified`, `leaveInInbox`, `archive`, `trash`, or `markRead`.

auto_forwarding_settings.description: An optional dictionary for updating auto-forwarding settings, containing keys: `enabled` (bool) to enable or disable forwarding; `emailAddress` (str) for the forwarding destination; and `disposition` (str) for message handling, with valid values: 'dispositionUnspecified', 'leaveInInbox', 'archive', 'trash', 'markRead'.

name: update_draft
description: Updates an existing draft message with the provided `draft` content, ensuring the 'DRAFT' label is present, and returns `None` if the draft does not exist.

userId.description: The user's email address or the special value `'me'` to indicate the authenticated user; defaults to `'me'`.

id.description: Unique identifier of the draft to update.
The immutable ID of the message.

threadId.description: The ID of the thread the message belongs to.

raw.description: The entire RFC 2822 compliant message, including attachments, as a base64url-encoded string (RFC 4648 Section 5). If omitted, the message is constructed from other fields.

labelIds.description: A list of label IDs to replace all existing labels on the message, except for the `DRAFT` label which is always preserved. The `INBOX` label is ignored if provided in the list.

snippet.description: A short excerpt of the message text.

historyId.description: ID of the last history record that modified the message.

internalDate.description: The internal creation timestamp in epoch milliseconds.

body.description: The body content of the message.

isRead.description: Indicates if the message has been read.

date.description: The date the message was created.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the message.
The MIME type of the part.

size.description: The size of the attachment in bytes.

parts.description: The list of message parts for attachments.

payload.description: An object representing the parsed email structure.

message.description: An object containing the message fields to update.

draft.description: An optional dictionary of key-value pairs to update in the draft message.

name: update_imap_settings
description: Updates the IMAP settings for the specified user, applying only the fields present in the provided `imap_settings`.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' for the authenticated user (default).

expungeBehavior.description: Specifies how to handle expunged messages.

imap_settings.description: An optional dictionary specifying IMAP settings to update, with keys for `enabled` (bool), `autoExpunge` (bool), and `expungeBehavior` (str); defaults to `None` for no changes.

name: update_label
description: Update an existing label identified by its ID, fully replacing its properties with those in the `label` argument.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' to indicate the authenticated user (default: 'me').

id.description: The ID of the label to update; defaults to an empty string.

name.description: The display name of the label; automatically converted to uppercase for system labels.

labelListVisibility.description: The visibility of the label in the label list, chosen from 'labelShow', 'labelShowIfUnread', or 'labelHide'.

messageListVisibility.description: The label's visibility in the message list, either 'show' or 'hide'.

type.description: The owner type for the label; must be 'user' for custom labels, and cannot be changed for system labels.

color.description: The color to assign to the label, specified as a dictionary with `textColor` (hex string) and `backgroundColor` (hex string `#RRGGBB`).

textColor.description: The label's text color, as a hex string.

backgroundColor.description: The background color as a #RRGGBB hex string.

label.description: An optional dictionary containing updated label properties such as `name`, list and message `visibility` settings, `type` (for custom labels), and a `color` dictionary with hex string values.

name: update_language_settings
description: Updates the specified user's language settings, modifying only fields present in the input `language_settings` dictionary.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' to represent the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

displayLanguage.description: The display language code, such as 'en-US' for English.

language_settings.description: An optional dictionary of language settings to update, with the `displayLanguage` key (a string language code like 'en-US').

name: update_pop_settings
description: Updates the specified user's POP settings, modifying only the fields present in the provided `pop_settings` dictionary.

userId.description: The user's email address; 'me' indicates the authenticated user and is the default.

accessWindow.description: The range of messages accessible via POP, with valid values: 'accessWindowUnspecified', 'disabled', 'fromNowOn', 'allMail'.

disposition.description: Determines how messages are handled after POP access, with valid values: `dispositionUnspecified`, `leaveInInbox`, `archive`, `trash`, or `markRead`.

pop_settings.description: An optional dictionary for updating POP settings, containing `accessWindow` (string) and `disposition` (string) keys, each with specific valid values.

name: update_send_as_alias
description: Fully update an existing 'Send as' alias, identified by its email address, with properties from the `send_as` argument.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' for the authenticated user, which is also the default.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the 'Send as' alias to update; defaults to ''.

send_as.description: An optional dictionary of updated 'Send as' alias properties, including `displayName`, `replyToAddress`, and `signature`.

name: update_send_as_smime_info
description: Updates an existing S/MIME certificate configuration by its ID, performing a full replacement of existing properties.

userId.description: The user's email address, defaulting to 'me' to represent the authenticated user.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the 'Send as' alias associated with the S/MIME info; defaults to an empty string.

id.description: The ID of the S/MIME info to update; defaults to ''.

encryptedKey.description: Encrypted key for the S/MIME certificate.

smime.description: An optional dictionary of updated S/MIME properties, including the `encryptedKey` (str) and other optional S/MIME properties.

name: update_vacation_settings
description: Updates the specified user's vacation responder settings, applying only the fields present in the provided `vacation_settings`.

userId.description: The user's email address; defaults to 'me', which indicates the authenticated user.

responseSubject.description: Subject line of the auto-reply message.

responseBodyHtml.description: HTML body of the auto-reply message.

vacation_settings.description: An optional dictionary containing vacation settings to update, with keys such as `enableAutoReply` (bool), `responseSubject` (str), `responseBodyHtml` (str), and other optional settings; defaults to `None`.

name: verify_send_as_alias
description: Verifies a specified 'Send as' alias, updating its status to 'accepted' if pending verification is successful.

userId.description: The user's email address; defaults to 'me' to indicate the authenticated user.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the 'Send as' alias to verify, defaulting to an empty string.

name: watch_user_mailbox
description: Set up or update a watch on a user's mailbox.

userId.description: The user's email address; use 'me' to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

request.description: An optional dictionary for the watch request body, with its exact structure depending on watch configuration requirements; defaults to `None`, resulting in an empty configuration.
